page.title: 13Marsworth Reservoir
page.content: Administered by the National Nature Reserve by the Nature Conservancy Council they attract many visitors interested in the abundance of plants and wildlife, as well as anglers.The reservoirs are important for wildfowl and ducks and such species as Mallard, Shoveler,Teal, Wigeon,Great Crested and Little Grebes and Ruddy ducks.(a recent coloniser to Britain) congregate. An important wintering area and stopping off post for migratory species,occasional visitors include Marsh Harrier,Black, Common and Arctic Terns and Black_Necked Grebe. Swallows, Martins and Swifts occur in great numbers.600 Corn Bunting have been recorded roosting in the reed beds. Green Sandpiper, Greenshank,Yellow and Grey Wagtails, Reed and Sedge Warblers,Kingfisher, Reed Bunting and Heron are also seen.
